title: How to Make Gelatina De Leche (Milk Gelatin)

steps.headline: Hydrate the gelatin/agar.
steps.description: In a bowl, pour the powdered gelatin into the cold water. Mix to dissolve if needed and set aside. The gelatin/agar will thicken quickly. This is normal.

steps.headline: Boil the milk on the stove.
steps.description: Stir occasionally to prevent it from forming a skin on the surface or burning. Once the milk starts to bubble and foam, it's boiled.

steps.headline: Add the cinnamon sticks to the milk and simmer at medium heat for about 5 minutes.
steps.description: Breaking the cinnamon sticks into smaller pieces will help release more flavor, but don't break it into such small pieces that you can't remove them later.

steps.headline: Take out the cinnamon using a slotted spoon or another utensil.
steps.description: Try to get all pieces of the cinnamon out for a smoother texture and appearance.

steps.headline: Quickly add in the rest of the ingredients.
steps.description: Add in the vanilla, cream/evaporated milk, and condensed milk. Scoop in the thickened mass of gelatin/agar and stir until the gelatin has fully dissolved into the mixture.

steps.headline: Strain the mixture using a sieve.
steps.description: Strain the mixture into a bowl or mold that can hold 10 cups. This will remove any lumps for a smooth product. A bundt cake mold is perfect for creating a presentable shape. You can also divide the mixture into separate containers.

steps.headline: Let the mixture cool to room temperature and then refrigerate.
steps.description: Refrigerate until fully set, or about 3 hours.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Serve like you would individual pudding cups, or slice like a cake and serve as such. Run a knife around the edges of the containers to make sure the jelly comes out in one piece. Add toppings such as fresh strawberries or jam for a delicious snack!
